intro: Aldama peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian Aldama, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at higher elevations. It has a woody stem and can reach heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is considered rare in the wild.
